coconut_details.description: Coconut is a versatile fruit known for its hard shell, fibrous husk, and nutritious water and meat inside. It is commonly found in tropical regions and is prized for its culinary and non-culinary uses.
coconut_details.nutritional value: Coconut water is low in calories and fat-free, while coconut meat is rich in healthy fats, fiber, vitamins, and minerals. It offers hydration, supports digestion, and provides energy.
coconut_details.cultivation: Coconuts grow on coconut palm trees in tropical and subtropical regions with sandy soil and abundant sunlight. They require high humidity, ample water, and protection from strong winds.
coconut_details.uses: Consumption of coconut water and meat, Cooking oil (coconut oil), Cosmetics, Fiber production (from husk), Construction materials (from shell)

prerequisites.soil: Sandy, well-drained soil with good water retention
prerequisites.climate: Tropical or subtropical climate with temperatures consistently above 80°F (27°C)
prerequisites.water: Regular watering, especially during dry periods, to maintain soil moisture
prerequisites.wind_protection: Protection from strong winds, as they can damage coconut palms and hinder fruit production
prerequisites.space: Sufficient space for tree growth, typically 25-30 feet apart for planting.
